text:
Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
    right rib fractures #[**6-2**], pnx, and 2 CT.  rated pain [**8-31**] when
   coughing and deep breathing.
   Action:
   -Tordol extended for another 3 days
   - Dilaudid given prn
   - Dilaudid pca started .12/6/1.2
   - Tylenol 1gm ATC
   - neurontin started
   - lidocain patch on 8pm/ off 8am
   - bowel regime ( senna and colace) started
   - OOB
   - family at bedside
   Response:
   Better pain control with PCA, pt using appropriately, rates pain at 3
   when coughing instead of a [**8-31**] before PCA.
   Plan:
   Cont pain assessment, encourage pt to voice pain, pre medicate before
   turns.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   HX of emphysema (COPD)  s/p fall and sustained right rib fractures #
   [**6-2**] and a large PTX . pt has 2 CT , + fluct, no leaks, + sq emphysema
   in chest, and arms, lung sounds decreased on right and exp wheeze on
   left. On 3L nc.
   Action:
   -          Albuterol, ipatropium nebs ATC
   -          OOB to chair
   -          IS and C&DB
   -          CT to H2o seal this am
   -          CXR done
   -          Ct from OSH d/c ( right anteroir)
   -          O2 weaned to tolerate sat low 90
s to high 80
   Response:
   With better pain control pt able to cough more effectively and
   productively. Sat low 90
s. tolerating OOB to chair well.
   Plan:
   Cont pulm toilet, Tx to floor in am.

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
